column4: Could not init font path element unix/:7100, removing from list!
Run from a terminal.  Look at its error output.
i have 4.6 gig root partition and no office apps and i run out of disk space thats crazy
For a current Linux install, I'd start at around 6 GB myself.  'df -h' will show a summary of free space in your partitions.
'du -s <dirlist>' will give a summary of usage by directory.  There's also an interactive GUI tool, 'filelight' which shows disk usage.
but thats crazy i did fine last round with this
Arguing with your filesystem about how much free disk you've got is sort of pointless.
Anyway, google "linux partitioning" if you want my view on things.
this is crazy i cant belive this thing has used all that space heres mdk root   /dev/hdb1             7.5G 1019M  6.2G  15% /mnt/mdkrt2
something is being reported wrong got to be
Got any open, but deleted files?
lsof and du are your friends.  I'm busy with other stuff, RTFM or ask the channel.
